original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~~~(food for thought)~~~Say "thank you" a lot.

Our Meditation for Today:
In bringing many sons to glory, it was fitting that God, 
for whom and through whom everything exists, should
make the author of their salvation perfect through
suffering...(Heb. 2:10)

Our Thought for Today:
Have you ever wondered how Jesus was made perfect through suffering?

Well the suffering that Jesus accepted on our behalf made Him a perfect 
leader or pioneer, of our salvation. Jesus Himself did not need to suffer for
His own salvation, because He was God in human form...

His perfect obedience (which led Him down the road of suffering) demonstrates 
that He was the complete sacrifice for us...

Through suffering, Jesus completed the work necessary for our own salvation.
Our suffering can make us more sensitive servants of God...

People who have known pain are able to reach out with compassion to others 
who hurt. If you have suffered, ask God how your experience can be used to
help others...

Our Prayer for Today:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the gift of eternal life
that is mine through faith in the finished work of Jesus Christ.
Forgive me for complaining about my trails, and show me how
I can use those experiences to help others...Amen

Keep looking up, if you truly believe you will achieve...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Have you ever wondered how Jesus was made perfect through suffering? Well the suffering that Jesus accepted on our behalf made Him a perfect leader or pioneer, of our salvation. Jesus Himself did not need to suffer for His own salvation, because He was God in human form. His perfect obedience (which led Him down the road of suffering) demonstrates that He was the complete sacrifice for us. Through suffering, Jesus completed the work necessary for our own salvation. Our suffering can make us more sensitive servants of God. People who have known pain are able to reach out with compassion to others who hurt. If you have suffered, ask God how your experience can be used to help others.
original_verse_text: In bringing many sons to glory, it was fitting that God, for whom and through whom everything exists, should make the author of their salvation perfect through suffering.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the gift of eternal life that is mine through faith in the finished work of Jesus Christ. Forgive me for complaining about my trails, and show me how I can use those experiences to help others. Amen.
reflection: Have you ever wondered how Jesus was made perfect through suffering? Well the suffering that Jesus accepted on our behalf made Him a perfect leader or pioneer, of our salvation. Jesus Himself did not need to suffer for His own salvation, because He was God in human form. His perfect obedience (which led Him down the road of suffering) demonstrates that He was the complete sacrifice for us. Through suffering, Jesus completed the work necessary for our own salvation. Our suffering can make us more sensitive servants of God. People who have known pain are able to reach out with compassion to others who hurt. If you have suffered, ask God how your experience can be used to help others.
subject: The Perfection of Jesus Through Suffering
verse_text: In bringing many sons to glory, it was fitting that God, for whom and through whom everything exists, should make the author of their salvation perfect through suffering.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~~~~(food for thought)~~~Say "please" a lot.

Our Meditation for Today:
Both the one who makes men holy and those who are made holy
are of the same family. So Jesus is not ashamed to call them 
brothers...

He says, "I will declare your name to my brothers; in the presence 
of the congregation I will sing your praises.

And again, I will put my trust in him. and again he says "Here am I, 
and the children God has given me." (Heb. 2:11-13) NIV

Our Thought for Today:
We who have been set apart for God's service cleansed and made holy 
(sanctified) by Jesus now have the same Father as Jesus has, so He has 
made us His brothers and sisters...

Various psalms look forward to Christ and His work in the world . Here the 
writer has quoted a portion of Psalm 22, a messianic psalm...

Because God has adopted all believers as His children, Jesus calls them His 
brothers and sisters...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You that Jesus has made me, (a believer)
Your son. I pray for continued guidance by Your Holy Spirit, that I will
remain faithful all my days so that I would have a place prepared for me
in Your Heavenly Kingdom...Amen.

Keep looking up, for if you believe you will achieve...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: We who have been set apart for God's service cleansed and made holy (sanctified) by Jesus now have the same Father as Jesus has, so He has made us His brothers and sisters. Various psalms look forward to Christ and His work in the world. Here the writer has quoted a portion of Psalm 22, a messianic psalm. Because God has adopted all believers as His children, Jesus calls them His brothers and sisters.

He says, "I will declare your name to my brothers; in the presence of the congregation I will sing your praises. And again, I will put my trust in him. and again he says "Here am I, and the children God has given me."
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You that Jesus has made me, (a believer) Your son. I pray for continued guidance by Your Holy Spirit, that I will remain faithful all my days so that I would have a place prepared for me in Your Heavenly Kingdom. Amen.
reflection: We who have been set apart for God's service cleansed and made holy (sanctified) by Jesus now have the same Father as Jesus has, so He has made us His brothers and sisters. Various psalms look forward to Christ and His work in the world. Here the writer has quoted a portion of Psalm 22, a messianic psalm. Because God has adopted all believers as His children, Jesus calls them His brothers and sisters.
subject: Adopted as God's Children, Siblings of Christ

He says, "I will declare your name to my brothers; in the presence of the congregation I will sing your praises. And again, I will put my trust in him. and again he says "Here am I, and the children God has given me."

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~~~~(food for thought)~~~Sing in the shower...

Our Devotion for Today:
Since the children have flesh and blood, He too shared in their
humanity so that by His death He might destroy him who holds
the power of death--that is, the devil--and free those who all their
lives were held in slavery by their fear of death...(Heb. 2:14, 15) NIV

Our Thought for Today:
Jesus had to become human so that He could die and rise again,
in order to destroy the Devil's power over death. (see Ro. 6:5-11)

Only then could Christ deliver those who had lived in constant fear
of death and free them to live for Him...Christ's death and resurrection
has set us free from the fear of death because death has been defeated.

When we belong to God, we need not fear death, because we know
that death is only the doorway into eternal life. (see I Cor. 15)

Those who fear death should have the opportunity to know the hope 
that Christ's victory binges...Begin to seek ways to share the truth with
those close to you...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You that the doorway to 
eternal life has been opened...I thank You for defeating 
death...Help me to see every opportunity to share the truth...Amen.

Keep looking up, if you believe you will achieve...
you're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Jesus had to become human so that He could die and rise again, in order to destroy the Devil's power over death. (see Romans 6:5-11) Only then could Christ deliver those who had lived in constant fear of death and free them to live for Him. Christ's death and resurrection has set us free from the fear of death because death has been defeated. When we belong to God, we need not fear death, because we know that death is only the doorway into eternal life. (see I Corinthians 15) Those who fear death should have the opportunity to know the hope that Christ's victory binges. Begin to seek ways to share the truth with those close to you.

prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You that the doorway to eternal life has been opened. I thank You for defeating death. Help me to see every opportunity to share the truth. Amen.
reflection: Jesus had to become human so that He could die and rise again, in order to destroy the Devil's power over death. (see Romans 6:5-11) Only then could Christ deliver those who had lived in constant fear of death and free them to live for Him. Christ's death and resurrection has set us free from the fear of death because death has been defeated. When we belong to God, we need not fear death, because we know that death is only the doorway into eternal life. (see I Corinthians 15) Those who fear death should have the opportunity to know the hope that Christ's victory binges. Begin to seek ways to share the truth with those close to you.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~~~~(food for thought)~~~Use the good silver...

Our Meditation for Today:
For surely it is not angels He helps, but Abraham's descendents...

For this reason He had to be made like His brothers in every way,
in order that He might become a merciful and faithful high priest
in service to God, and that He might make atonement for the sins 
of the people...(Heb. 2:16, 17) NIV

Our Thought for Today:
In the Old Testament, the high priest was the mediator between God 
and His people. His job was to regularly offer animal sacrifices according
to the law and to intercede with God for forgiveness for the people's sins.

Jesus Christ is now our high priest. He came to earth as a human being;
so, He understands our weaknesses and shows mercy to us...

He has once and for all paid the penalty for our sins by His own sacrificial 
death (atonement), and He can be depended on to restore our broken
relationship with God...

We are released from sin's domination over us when we commit ourselves 
fully to Christ, trusting completely in what He has done for us...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, You are our creator, comforter, and redeemer,
by You all things exist, by Your sacrifice the sins of all who trust in You
have received forgiveness of their sins...Once again I come to You asking
for forgiveness because I have sinned; I ask this in the name of Jesus...Amen.

Keep looking up, if you believe you will achieve...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: In the Old Testament, the high priest was the mediator between God and His people. His job was to regularly offer animal sacrifices according to the law and to intercede with God for forgiveness for the people's sins. Jesus Christ is now our high priest. He came to earth as a human being; so, He understands our weaknesses and shows mercy to us. He has once and for all paid the penalty for our sins by His own sacrificial death (atonement), and He can be depended on to restore our broken relationship with God. We are released from sin's domination over us when we commit ourselves fully to Christ, trusting completely in what He has done for us.

Once again I come to You asking for forgiveness because I have sinned; I ask this in the name of Jesus. Amen.
reflection: In the Old Testament, the high priest was the mediator between God and His people. His job was to regularly offer animal sacrifices according to the law and to intercede with God for forgiveness for the people's sins. Jesus Christ is now our high priest. He came to earth as a human being; so, He understands our weaknesses and shows mercy to us. He has once and for all paid the penalty for our sins by His own sacrificial death (atonement), and He can be depended on to restore our broken relationship with God. We are released from sin's domination over us when we commit ourselves fully to Christ, trusting completely in what He has done for us.
subject: The High Priest Who Understands Us

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~~~~(food for thought)~~~Be the first to say "Hello!"

Our Meditation for Today:
Because He Himself suffered when He was tempted, 
He is able to help those who are being tempted...(Heb. 2:18) NIV

Our Thought for Today:
Knowing that Christ suffered pain and faced temptation should
help us to face our trials...Jesus understands our struggles
because He faced them as a human being...

We can trust Christ to help us survive suffering and overcome 
temptation...So when you face trials, go to Jesus for strength 
and patience...He understands Your needs and is able to help.
(see Hebrews 4:14-16).

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your Love and mercy.
I thank You for Your understanding of the trials and temptations 
that I have to deal with. I pray for Your divine forgiveness, for all 
my sins...Bless and protect all my e-mail friends I pray in Jesus 
name...Amen.

Keep looking up, If you believe you will overcome...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Knowing that Christ suffered pain and faced temptation should help us to face our trials. Jesus understands our struggles because He faced them as a human being. We can trust Christ to help us survive suffering and overcome temptation. So when you face trials, go to Jesus for strength and patience. He understands Your needs and is able to help. (see Hebrews 4:14-16).
original_verse_text: Because He Himself suffered when He was tempted, He is able to help those who are being tempted.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your Love and mercy. I thank You for Your understanding of the trials and temptations that I have to deal with. I pray for Your divine forgiveness, for all my sins. Bless and protect all my friends I pray in Jesus name. Amen.
reflection: Knowing that Christ suffered pain and faced temptation should help us to face our trials. Jesus understands our struggles because He faced them as a human being. We can trust Christ to help us survive suffering and overcome temptation. So when you face trials, go to Jesus for strength and patience. He understands Your needs and is able to help. (see Hebrews 4:14-16).
subject: Facing Trials? Christ Understands Your Struggles
verse_text: Because He Himself suffered when He was tempted, He is able to help those who are being tempted.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~~~~(food for thought)~~~Live beneath your means...

Our Meditation for Today:
Therefore, holy brothers, who share in the heavenly calling,
fix your thoughts on Jesus, the apostle and high priest whom 
we confess...

He was faithful to the One who appointed Him, just as Moses 
was faithful in all God's house...

Jesus has been found worthy of greater honor than Moses, 
just as the builder of a house has greater honor than the 
house itself...(Heb. 3:1-3) NIV

Our Thought for Today:
To the Jewish people, Moses was a great hero; he had led their ancestors,
the Israelites, from Egyptian bondage to the border of the Promised Land.
He also had written the first five books of the Old Testament, and he was 
the prophet through whom God had given the Law. So it goes without saying
Moses was the greatest prophet in the Scriptures...

But Jesus is worthy of greater honor as the central figure of faith than Moses,
who was merely a human servant. Jesus is more than human; He is God Himself
(1:3). As Moses led the people of Israel out of Egyptian bondage, so Christ leads
us out of sin's slavery...

So the author of Hebrews asks, "Why settle for Moses, when you can have Jesus
Christ, who appointed Moses?"

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear heavenly Father, forgive me for ever putting anything or 
anyone else ahead of You. Help me to always be sensitive and
obedient to Your leading and guiding...Bless and keep my e-mail
friends safe this week. Help us each to put You first...Amen.

Keep looking up, if you believe you will achieve...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

He also had written the first five books of the Old Testament, and he was the prophet through whom God had given the Law. So it goes without saying Moses was the greatest prophet in the Scriptures. But Jesus is worthy of greater honor as the central figure of faith than Moses, who was merely a human servant. Jesus is more than human; He is God Himself (1:3). As Moses led the people of Israel out of Egyptian bondage, so Christ leads us out of sin's slavery. So the author of Hebrews asks, "Why settle for Moses, when you can have Jesus Christ, who appointed Moses?"

He was faithful to the One who appointed Him, just as Moses was faithful in all God's house. Jesus has been found worthy of greater honor than Moses, just as the builder of a house has greater honor than the house itself.
prayer: Dear heavenly Father, forgive me for ever putting anything or anyone else ahead of You. Help me to always be sensitive and obedient to Your leading and guiding. Bless and keep my friends safe this week. Help us each to put You first. Amen.
reflection: To the Jewish people, Moses was a great hero; he had led their ancestors, the Israelites, from Egyptian bondage to the border of the Promised Land. He also had written the first five books of the Old Testament, and he was the prophet through whom God had given the Law. So it goes without saying Moses was the greatest prophet in the Scriptures. But Jesus is worthy of greater honor as the central figure of faith than Moses, who was merely a human servant. Jesus is more than human; He is God Himself (1:3). As Moses led the people of Israel out of Egyptian bondage, so Christ leads us out of sin's slavery. So the author of Hebrews asks, "Why settle for Moses, when you can have Jesus Christ, who appointed Moses?"
subject: Embrace Jesus, the Greater Prophet

He was faithful to the One who appointed Him, just as Moses was faithful in all God's house. Jesus has been found worthy of greater honor than Moses, just as the builder of a house has greater honor than the house itself.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Drive inexpensive cars, but own the best house you can afford.

Our Meditation for Today:
For every house is built by someone, but God
is the builder of everything...(Heb. 3:5) NIV

Our Thought for Today:
All of God's words are trustworthy and true. The Bible
is reliable because, unlike people, God does not lie,
forget, change His words, or leave His promises unfulfilled

We can trust the Bible because it contains the words of a 
holy, trustworthy, and unchangeable God...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, in an ever changing world it is
so reassuring that in You Your promises always remain
the same...I thank You that we have Your Word, the (Bible)
in which we can grow in a closer walk with You...Thank 
You Lord for Your love and mercy which are new every day...Amen.

Keep looking up, if you continue to believe you will achieve...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: All of God's words are trustworthy and true. The Bible is reliable because, unlike people, God does not lie, forget, change His words, or leave His promises unfulfilled We can trust the Bible because it contains the words of a holy, trustworthy, and unchangeable God.

prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, in an ever changing world it is so reassuring that in You Your promises always remain the same. I thank You that we have Your Word, the (Bible) in which we can grow in a closer walk with You. Thank You Lord for Your love and mercy which are new every day. Amen.

subject: Trustworthy Words of the Unchanging God
verse_text: For every house is built by someone, but God is the builder of everything.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Buy great books even if you never read them...

Our Meditation for Today:

But Christ is faithful as a son over God's house. 
And we are His house, if we hold on to our courage 
and the hope of which we boast. (Heb. 3:6) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Because Christ lives in us as believers, we can remain courageous
and hopeful to the end... We are not saved by being steadfast and
firm in our faith, BUT, our courage and hope do reveal that our faith
is real...

Without this enduring faithfulness, we could easily be blown away by
the winds of temptation, false teaching, or persecution...(see 3:14).

Our Prayer for Today:
I thank You for Your presence in my life through the Holy Spirit.
Help me to always be alert to any false teaching that Satan would
try to plant in my life...I pray You would bless and keep each and 
every person receiving this e-mail...Amen.

Keep looking up, if you believe you will achieve...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Because Christ lives in us as believers, we can remain courageous and hopeful to the end. We are not saved by being steadfast and firm in our faith, BUT, our courage and hope do reveal that our faith is real. Without this enduring faithfulness, we could easily be blown away by the winds of temptation, false teaching, or persecution. (see 3:14).
original_verse_text: But Christ is faithful as a son over God's house. And we are His house, if we hold on to our courage and the hope of which we boast.
prayer: I thank You for Your presence in my life through the Holy Spirit. Help me to always be alert to any false teaching that Satan would try to plant in my life. I pray You would bless and keep each and every person. Amen.
reflection: Because Christ lives in us as believers, we can remain courageous and hopeful to the end. We are not saved by being steadfast and firm in our faith, BUT, our courage and hope do reveal that our faith is real. Without this enduring faithfulness, we could easily be blown away by the winds of temptation, false teaching, or persecution. (see 3:14).
subject: Courageous and Hopeful in Christ
verse_text: But Christ is faithful as a son over God's house. And we are His house, if we hold on to our courage and the hope of which we boast.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~~~~(food for thought)~~~Be forgiving of yourself and others...

Our Meditation for Today:
See to it, brothers, that none of you has a sinful, unbelieving 
heart that turns away from the living God...

But encourage one another daily, as long as it is called 
Today, so that none of you may be hardened by sin's 
deceitfulness...

We have come to share in Christ if we hold firmly till the 
end the confidence we had at first...(Heb. 3:12-14) NIV

Our Thought for Today:
Our hearts turn away from the living God when we stubbornly 
refuse to believe in Him. If we persist in our unbelief, God
will eventually leave us alone in our sin...

BUT God can give us new hearts, new desires, and new spirits,
as we see by (Ezek. 36:22-27)...

To prevent having an unbelieving heart, stay in fellowship with 
other believers, talk daily about your mutual faith, be aware of
the deceitfulness of sin (it attacks but also destroys), and 
encourage each other with love and concern...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear heavenly Father, help me to always have a sensitive and 
obedient heart...Create in me a righteous heart, with a desire to
live in closer fellowship with You...Help me to also grow closer in
a mutual faith with other believers, so that we can encourage one
another with love and concern...Amen

Keep looking up, our Savior has promised eternal life...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Our hearts turn away from the living God when we stubbornly refuse to believe in Him. If we persist in our unbelief, God will eventually leave us alone in our sin. BUT God can give us new hearts, new desires, and new spirits, as we see by (Ezek. 36:22-27). To prevent having an unbelieving heart, stay in fellowship with other believers, talk daily about your mutual faith, be aware of the deceitfulness of sin (it attacks but also destroys), and encourage each other with love and concern.

But encourage one another daily, as long as it is called Today, so that none of you may be hardened by sin's deceitfulness. We have come to share in Christ if we hold firmly till the end the confidence we had at first.
prayer: Dear heavenly Father, help me to always have a sensitive and obedient heart. Create in me a righteous heart, with a desire to live in closer fellowship with You. Help me to also grow closer in a mutual faith with other believers, so that we can encourage one another with love and concern. Amen.
reflection: Our hearts turn away from the living God when we stubbornly refuse to believe in Him. If we persist in our unbelief, God will eventually leave us alone in our sin. BUT God can give us new hearts, new desires, and new spirits, as we see by (Ezek. 36:22-27). To prevent having an unbelieving heart, stay in fellowship with other believers, talk daily about your mutual faith, be aware of the deceitfulness of sin (it attacks but also destroys), and encourage each other with love and concern.
subject: Turning Away from the Living God

But encourage one another daily, as long as it is called Today, so that none of you may be hardened by sin's deceitfulness. We have come to share in Christ if we hold firmly till the end the confidence we had at first.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Always put your best foot forward...

Our Meditation for Today:
Who were they who heard and rebelled? Were they not all those
who Moses led out of Egypt?

And with whom was He angry with for forty years? Was it not with
those who had sinned, whose bodies fell in the desert?

And with whom did God swear that they would never enter His
rest if not to those who disobeyed?

So we see that they were not able to enter, because of their 
unbelief...(Heb. 3:16-19) NIV

Our Thought for Today:
The important truths are that the people who failed to enter Canaan
were the people who had heard God's promise. They did not believe 
in God's protection...

They did not believe that God would help them conquer the giants in
the land...So God sent them into the wilderness to wander for 40 Years.

This was an unhappy alternative to the wonderful gift he had planned for
them...

Be ever mindful of the fact, that the lack of trust in God always prevents
us from receiving His best...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, thank You for all the wonderful promises
that we find in Your Word. By Your Holy Spirit's power I pray that
I would remain faithful, so that I might receive Your best...Amen.

Keep looking up, that you might receive His best...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: The important truths are that the people who failed to enter Canaan were the people who had heard God's promise. They did not believe in God's protection. They did not believe that God would help them conquer the giants in the land. So God sent them into the wilderness to wander for 40 Years. This was an unhappy alternative to the wonderful gift he had planned for them. Be ever mindful of the fact, that the lack of trust in God always prevents us from receiving His best.

Was it not with those who had sinned, whose bodies fell in the desert? And with whom did God swear that they would never enter His rest if not to those who disobeyed? So we see that they were not able to enter, because of their unbelief.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, thank You for all the wonderful promises that we find in Your Word. By Your Holy Spirit's power I pray that I would remain faithful, so that I might receive Your best. Amen.
reflection: The important truths are that the people who failed to enter Canaan were the people who had heard God's promise. They did not believe in God's protection. They did not believe that God would help them conquer the giants in the land. So God sent them into the wilderness to wander for 40 Years. This was an unhappy alternative to the wonderful gift he had planned for them. Be ever mindful of the fact, that the lack of trust in God always prevents us from receiving His best.
subject: Lack of Trust Prevents God's Best
verse_text: Who were they who heard and rebelled? Were they not all those who Moses led out of Egypt? And with whom was He angry with for forty years? Was it not with those who had sinned, whose bodies fell in the desert? And with whom did God swear that they would never enter His rest if not to those who disobeyed? So we see that they were not able to enter, because of their unbelief.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Return everything you borrow...

If you received this at the beginning of the week let me know I had
four devo's prepared to go out on Tue. morning as I was going to 
be gone for (4) days but the way it appeared they did not go out so
I am sending them individually starting to day...

Our Meditation for Today:

Therefore, since the promise of entering His rest stands,
let us be careful that none of you be found to have fallen 
short of it...(Heb. 4:1) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Some of the Jewish Christians who received this letter may have been
on the verge of turning back from their promised rest in Christ, just as
the people of Moses' day had turned back from the promised land...

In both cases, the difficulties of the present moment over-shadowed the
reality of God's promise, and the people doubted that God would fulfil
His promises...

The problem many have today is that they trust in their own efforts instead
of Christ's power, then they are in danger of turning back. They will eventually
see that their own efforts are never adequate; because only Christ can see 
us through...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for Godly wisdom in how
to deal with problems that come my way. I need this 
wisdom so that I would not look to my own strength or
wisdom in dealing with my everyday problems. Help me
to always depend on You, for in You all things are possible...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Some of the Jewish Christians who received this letter may have been on the verge of turning back from their promised rest in Christ, just as the people of Moses' day had turned back from the promised land. In both cases, the difficulties of the present moment overshadowed the reality of God's promise, and the people doubted that God would fulfill His promises. The problem many have today is that they trust in their own efforts instead of Christ's power, then they are in danger of turning back. They will eventually see that their own efforts are never adequate; because only Christ can see us through.
original_verse_text: Therefore, since the promise of entering His rest stands, let us be careful that none of you be found to have fallen short of it.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for Godly wisdom in how to deal with problems that come my way. I need this wisdom so that I would not look to my own strength or wisdom in dealing with my everyday problems. Help me to always depend on You, for in You all things are possible. Amen.
reflection: Some of the Jewish Christians who received this letter may have been on the verge of turning back from their promised rest in Christ, just as the people of Moses' day had turned back from the promised land. In both cases, the difficulties of the present moment overshadowed the reality of God's promise, and the people doubted that God would fulfill His promises. The problem many have today is that they trust in their own efforts instead of Christ's power, then they are in danger of turning back. They will eventually see that their own efforts are never adequate; because only Christ can see us through.
subject: Trusting God's Promises, Not Our Efforts
verse_text: Therefore, since the promise of entering His rest stands, let us be careful that none of you be found to have fallen short of it.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Treat everyone you meet like you want to be treated...

Our Meditation for Today:

We also have had the gospel preached to us, just as they did;
but the message they heard was of no value to them, because
those who heard did not combine it with faith...(Heb. 4:2) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

The Israelites of Moses' day illustrate a problem that is facing
many who fill our churches today. They know a great deal about
Christ, but many do not know Him personally...

They do not combine their knowledge with faith. We need to let 
the Good News about Christ benefit our lives. We need to believe
in Him then act on what we know. We need to trust in Christ and
then do what He says...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, as I learn more about You, I pray
that my faith would also grow. May I learn to trust You
more each day and grow in faithfulness...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: The Israelites of Moses' day illustrate a problem that is facing many who fill our churches today. They know a great deal about Christ, but many do not know Him personally. They do not combine their knowledge with faith. We need to let the Good News about Christ benefit our lives. We need to believe in Him then act on what we know. We need to trust in Christ and then do what He says.
original_verse_text: We also have had the gospel preached to us, just as they did; but the message they heard was of no value to them, because those who heard did not combine it with faith.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, as I learn more about You, I pray that my faith would also grow. May I learn to trust You more each day and grow in faithfulness. Amen.
reflection: The Israelites of Moses' day illustrate a problem that is facing many who fill our churches today. They know a great deal about Christ, but many do not know Him personally. They do not combine their knowledge with faith. We need to let the Good News about Christ benefit our lives. We need to believe in Him then act on what we know. We need to trust in Christ and then do what He says.
subject: Knowing Christ Personally Transforms Lives
verse_text: We also have had the gospel preached to us, just as they did; but the message they heard was of no value to them, because those who heard did not combine it with faith.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Life isn't always fair, but it's still good...

Our Meditation for Today:
Somewhere He has spoken about the seventh day in these words:
"And on the seventh day God rested from His work." (Heb. 4:4) NIV

Our Thought for Today:
Yes God did rest on the seventh day, but not because He was tired,
but to indicate the completion of creation. The world was perfect,
and God was well pleased with it...

This rest is a foretaste of our eternal joy when creation will be renewed
and restored, every mark of sin will be removed, and the world will be
made perfect again...

Our Sabbath-rest in Christ begins when we trust in Him to complete His
good and perfect work in us...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I long for the day when all sin will
be removed, and the world will be made perfect again...
I pray for a revival, and that it would begin with me...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Yes God did rest on the seventh day, but not because He was tired, but to indicate the completion of creation. The world was perfect, and God was well pleased with it. This rest is a foretaste of our eternal joy when creation will be renewed and restored, every mark of sin will be removed, and the world will be made perfect again. Our Sabbath-rest in Christ begins when we trust in Him to complete His good and perfect work in us.
original_verse_text: Somewhere He has spoken about the seventh day in these words: "And on the seventh day God rested from His work."
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I long for the day when all sin will be removed, and the world will be made perfect again. I pray for a revival, and that it would begin with me. Amen.
reflection: Yes God did rest on the seventh day, but not because He was tired, but to indicate the completion of creation. The world was perfect, and God was well pleased with it. This rest is a foretaste of our eternal joy when creation will be renewed and restored, every mark of sin will be removed, and the world will be made perfect again. Our Sabbath-rest in Christ begins when we trust in Him to complete His good and perfect work in us.
subject: The Completion of God's Creation
verse_text: Somewhere He has spoken about the seventh day in these words: "And on the seventh day God rested from His work."

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Do not divulge secrets...

Our Meditation for Today:

It still remains that some will enter that rest, and those who formerly
had the gospel preached to them did not go in, because of their
disobedience.

Therefore God again set a certain day, calling it Today, when a long
time later He spoke through David, as was said before: "Today, if
you hear His voice, do not harden your hearts." (Heb. 4:6, 7) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

God had given the Israelites the opportunity to enter Canaan, but they
disobeyed and fail to enter (Num. 13, 14)...

Now God offers us the opportunity to enter His ultimate place of rest.
He invites us to come to Christ...

To enter His rest, you must believe that God has this relationship in mind
for you; you must stop trying to create it; you must trust in Christ for it; and
you must determine to obey Him...

Today is the best time to find peace with God. Tomorrow may be to late...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Lord, I thank you for the relationship You have planned for me
in Christ. I thank You for the true peace that is mine in You. The
world promises many things but fails to deliver, thus causing stress
for those who do not know You. So my prayer today is that they would 
come to a personal relationship with You that they may have true peace...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: God had given the Israelites the opportunity to enter Canaan, but they disobeyed and fail to enter (Numbers 13, 14). Now God offers us the opportunity to enter His ultimate place of rest. He invites us to come to Christ. To enter His rest, you must believe that God has this relationship in mind for you; you must stop trying to create it; you must trust in Christ for it; and you must determine to obey Him. Today is the best time to find peace with God. Tomorrow may be to late.

Therefore God again set a certain day, calling it Today, when a long time later He spoke through David, as was said before: "Today, if you hear His voice, do not harden your hearts."
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank you for the relationship You have planned for me in Christ. I thank You for the true peace that is mine in You. The world promises many things but fails to deliver, thus causing stress for those who do not know You. So my prayer today is that they would come to a personal relationship with You that they may have true peace. Amen.
reflection: God had given the Israelites the opportunity to enter Canaan, but they disobeyed and fail to enter (Numbers 13, 14). Now God offers us the opportunity to enter His ultimate place of rest. He invites us to come to Christ. To enter His rest, you must believe that God has this relationship in mind for you; you must stop trying to create it; you must trust in Christ for it; and you must determine to obey Him. Today is the best time to find peace with God. Tomorrow may be to late.
subject: Entering God's Rest Through Faith in Christ

Therefore God again set a certain day, calling it Today, when a long time later He spoke through David, as was said before: "Today, if you hear His voice, do not harden your hearts."

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~When in doubt, just take the next small step...

Our Meditation for Today:

For if Joshua had given them rest, God would not have spoken later
about another day...

There remains, then, a Sabbath-rest for the people of God:

for anyone who enters God's rest also rests from his own work, 
just as God did from His rest.

Let us, therefore, make every effort to enter that rest, so that no one will
fall by following their example of disobedience...(Heb. 4:8-11) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

God wants us to enter His rest. For the Israelites of Moses' time, this rest 
was the earthly rest to be found in the Promised Land...

For Christians, it is peace with God now and eternal life on the new earth later.
We do not need to wait for the next life to enjoy God's rest and peace; we may
have it daily now!

Our daily rest in the Lord will not end with death but will become an eternal rest
in the place that Christ is preparing for us (Jn. 14:1-4).

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the Peace that is mine in You.
I thank You for the promise of eternal life in the place Christ has prepared.
I pray for peace and protection for our countries troops. I also pray for
protection for the innocent in Iraq...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: God wants us to enter His rest. For the Israelites of Moses' time, this rest was the earthly rest to be found in the Promised Land. For Christians, it is peace with God now and eternal life on the new earth later. We do not need to wait for the next life to enjoy God's rest and peace; we may have it daily now! Our daily rest in the Lord will not end with death but will become an eternal rest in the place that Christ is preparing for us (John 14:1-4).
original_verse_text: For if Joshua had given them rest, God would not have spoken later about another day. There remains, then, a Sabbath-rest for the people of God: for anyone who enters God's rest also rests from his own work, just as God did from His rest. Let us, therefore, make every effort to enter that rest, so that no one will fall by following their example of disobedience.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the Peace that is mine in You. I thank You for the promise of eternal life in the place Christ has prepared. I pray for peace and protection for our countries troops. Amen.
reflection: God wants us to enter His rest. For the Israelites of Moses' time, this rest was the earthly rest to be found in the Promised Land. For Christians, it is peace with God now and eternal life on the new earth later. We do not need to wait for the next life to enjoy God's rest and peace; we may have it daily now! Our daily rest in the Lord will not end with death but will become an eternal rest in the place that Christ is preparing for us (John 14:1-4).
subject: Discover the Rest God Offers You
verse_text: For if Joshua had given them rest, God would not have spoken later about another day. There remains, then, a Sabbath-rest for the people of God: for anyone who enters God's rest also rests from his own work, just as God did from His rest. Let us, therefore, make every effort to enter that rest, so that no one will fall by following their example of disobedience.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Life is to short to waste time hating anyone.

Our Meditation for Today:

For the Word of God is living and active. Sharper than any 
double-edged sword, it penetrates even to dividing soul and
spirit, joints and marrow; it judges the thoughts and attitudes
of the heart. (Heb. 4:12) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

The Word of God is not simply a collection of words from God,
or a vehicle for communicating ideas; it is living, life-changing,
and dynamic as it works in us...

Like the keenness of a surgeon's knife, God's Word reveals who 
we are and what we are not. It penetrates the core of our moral and 
spiritual life...

It discerns what is in us, both good and evil. The demands of God's 
Word require decisions. We must not only listen to the Word; we
must also let it shape our life...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your Word for it is
a lamp unto my feet and a light unto my path. I pray that
I would always allow it to speak to my heart, so that I may
not sin against you...Amen.

Keep looking up. with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: The Word of God is not simply a collection of words from God, or a vehicle for communicating ideas; it is living, life-changing, and dynamic as it works in us. Like the keenness of a surgeon's knife, God's Word reveals who we are and what we are not. It penetrates the core of our moral and spiritual life. It discerns what is in us, both good and evil. The demands of God's Word require decisions. We must not only listen to the Word; we must also let it shape our life.

prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your Word for it is a lamp unto my feet and a light unto my path. I pray that I would always allow it to speak to my heart, so that I may not sin against you. Amen.

Like the keenness of a surgeon's knife, God's Word reveals who we are and what we are not. It penetrates the core of our moral and spiritual life. It discerns what is in us, both good and evil. The demands of God's Word require decisions. We must not only listen to the Word; we must also let it shape our life.
subject: Allowing God's Living Word to Transform Us

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Don't take yourself so seriously. No one else does...

Our Meditation for Today:

Nothing in all creation is hidden from God's sight.
Everything is uncovered and laid bare before the
eyes of Him to whom we must give an account...(Heb. 4:13) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Nothing can be hidden from God. He knows about everyone 
every where, and everything about us is wide open to His all
seeing eyes...

God sees all we do and knows all we think. Even when we are
unaware of His presence, He is there...

When we try to hide from Him, He sees us. We can have no secrets 
from God. But it is comforting to realize that although God knows us 
intimately He still loves us...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, granted it is a little unnerving to think You 
know everything about me; but at the same time it is comforting to
know You still love me...Being You know all things then You know
that I have much to confess...Forgive me for my sins of thought,
word, and deed, my sins of commission, and my sins of omission.
I pray all these things in Jesus name...Amen.

Keep looking up with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Nothing can be hidden from God. He knows about everyone every where, and everything about us is wide open to His all seeing eyes. God sees all we do and knows all we think. Even when we are unaware of His presence, He is there. When we try to hide from Him, He sees us. We can have no secrets from God. But it is comforting to realize that although God knows us intimately He still loves us.
original_verse_text: Nothing in all creation is hidden from God's sight. Everything is uncovered and laid bare before the eyes of Him to whom we must give an account.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, granted it is a little unnerving to think You know everything about me; but at the same time it is comforting to know You still love me. Being You know all things then You know that I have much to confess. Forgive me for my sins of thought, word, and deed, my sins of commission, and my sins of omission. I pray all these things in Jesus name. Amen.
reflection: Nothing can be hidden from God. He knows about everyone every where, and everything about us is wide open to His all seeing eyes. God sees all we do and knows all we think. Even when we are unaware of His presence, He is there. When we try to hide from Him, He sees us. We can have no secrets from God. But it is comforting to realize that although God knows us intimately He still loves us.
subject: Embracing God's All-Seeing Presence
verse_text: Nothing in all creation is hidden from God's sight. Everything is uncovered and laid bare before the eyes of Him to whom we must give an account.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Pay off your credit cards every month...

Our Meditation for Today:

Therefore, since we have a great High Priest who has gone
through the heavens, Jesus the Son of God, let us hold firmly
to the faith we profess...(Heb. 4:14) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Christ is superior to the priests, and His priesthood is superior to
their priesthood. To the Jews, the high priest was the highest
religious authority in the land...

He alone entered the Holy of Holies in the temple once a year to 
make atonement for the sins of the whole nation as we see by (Lev. 16).

Like the high priest, Jesus mediates between God and us. As humanities
representative, He intercedes for us before God, As God's representative,
He assures us of God's forgiveness...

Jesus has more authority than the Jewish high priests because He is truly 
God and truly man. Unlike the high priest, who could only go before God
once a year, Christ is always at God's right hand, interceding for us...

He is always available to hear us when we pray...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your Son, our redeemer
and mediator, our representative. I thank you that You have
provided a High Priest who continually hears our prayers...
This morning I as that You would bless my friends with good
health and safety...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

He alone entered the Holy of Hollies in the temple once a year to make atonement for the sins of the whole nation as we see by (Leviticus 16). Like the high priest, Jesus mediates between God and us. As humanities representative, He intercedes for us before God, As God's representative, He assures us of God's forgiveness. Jesus has more authority than the Jewish high priests because He is truly God and truly man. Unlike the high priest, who could only go before God once a year, Christ is always at God's right hand, interceding for us. He is always available to hear us when we pray.

He alone entered the Holy of Hollies in the temple once a year to make atonement for the sins of the whole nation as we see by (Leviticus 16). Like the high priest, Jesus mediates between God and us. As humanities representative, He intercedes for us before God, As God's representative, He assures us of God's forgiveness. Jesus has more authority than the Jewish high priests because He is truly God and truly man. Unlike the high priest, who could only go before God once a year, Christ is always at God's right hand, interceding for us. He is always available to hear us when we pray.
subject: The Superior Priesthood of Christ
verse_text: Therefore, since we have a great High Priest who has gone through the heavens, Jesus the Son of God, let us hold firmly to the faith we profess.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~You don't have to win every argument. Agree to disagree...

Our Meditation for Today:

For we do not have a high priest who is unable to sympathize
with our weaknesses, but we have one who has been tempted
in every way, just as we are, yet was without sin...(Heb. 4:15) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Jesus is like us because He experienced a full range of temptations 
throughout His life as a human being...

We can be comforted in knowing that Jesus faced temptation, and so
He can sympathize with us. We can be encouraged knowing that Jesus 
faced temptation without giving in to sin...

He shows us that we do not have to sin when facing the seductive lure 
of temptation. Jesus is the only perfect human being who has ever lived.

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I am comforted by the fact that You do
sympathize with us when we fall into temptation. But I also realize
that this does not mean that You excuse us for doing it; so I pray
that You would forgive me of my sins of thought word and deed...Amen.

Keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Jesus is like us because He experienced a full range of temptations throughout His life as a human being. We can be comforted in knowing that Jesus faced temptation, and so He can sympathize with us. We can be encouraged knowing that Jesus faced temptation without giving in to sin. He shows us that we do not have to sin when facing the seductive lure of temptation. Jesus is the only perfect human being who has ever lived.
original_verse_text: For we do not have a high priest who is unable to sympathize with our weaknesses, but we have one who has been tempted in every way, just as we are, yet was without sin.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I am comforted by the fact that You do sympathize with us when we fall into temptation. But I also realize that this does not mean that You excuse us for doing it; so I pray that You would forgive me of my sins of thought word and deed. Amen.
reflection: Jesus is like us because He experienced a full range of temptations throughout His life as a human being. We can be comforted in knowing that Jesus faced temptation, and so He can sympathize with us. We can be encouraged knowing that Jesus faced temptation without giving in to sin. He shows us that we do not have to sin when facing the seductive lure of temptation. Jesus is the only perfect human being who has ever lived.
subject: Tempted yet Triumphant: Jesus' Empathy for Us
verse_text: For we do not have a high priest who is unable to sympathize with our weaknesses, but we have one who has been tempted in every way, just as we are, yet was without sin.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~Cry with someone. It's more healing than crying alone.

Our Meditation for Today:

Let us then approach the throne of grace with confidence,
so that we may receive mercy and find grace to help us in
our time of need...(Heb. 4:16) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

We approach the throne of grace through prayer not in fear
but "boldly." 

Some Christians approach God meekly with heads hung low,
afraid to ask God to meet their needs. Others pray flippantly,
giving little thought to what they say...

Come with reverence because He is Your King. But also with 
bold assurance because He is your Friend and Counselor...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your Grace and Mercy.
I thank You for my health, home, food, family, e-mail friends, 
and our countries freedoms. BUT most of all I thank You for
my salvation in Jesus Christ. I thank You that I can come to
You with the assurance that You hear my prayers. My request
today is that my family, and e-mail friend would receive good
health and safety...Amen.

Keep looking Up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: We approach the throne of grace through prayer not in fear but "boldly." Some Christians approach God meekly with heads hung low, afraid to ask God to meet their needs. Others pray flippantly, giving little thought to what they say. Come with reverence because He is Your King. But also with bold assurance because He is your Friend and Counselor.
original_verse_text: Let us then approach the throne of grace with confidence, so that we may receive mercy and find grace to help us in our time of need.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your Grace and Mercy. I thank You for my health, home, food, family, and our countries freedoms. BUT most of all I thank You for my salvation in Jesus Christ. I thank You that I can come to You with the assurance that You hear my prayers. My request today is that my family, and friends would receive good health and safety. Amen.
reflection: We approach the throne of grace through prayer not in fear but "boldly." Some Christians approach God meekly with heads hung low, afraid to ask God to meet their needs. Others pray flippantly, giving little thought to what they say. Come with reverence because He is Your King. But also with bold assurance because He is your Friend and Counselor.
subject: Approach God's Throne with Boldness
verse_text: Let us then approach the throne of grace with confidence, so that we may receive mercy and find grace to help us in our time of need.

original_content:
GOOD MORNING!!!~~~(food for thought)~~~It's OK to get angry with God. He can take it...

Our Meditation for Today:

During the days of Jesus' life on earth, He offered up 
prayers and petitions with loud cries and tears to the 
One who could save Him from death, and He was 
heard because of His reverent submission...(Heb. 5:7) NIV

Our Thought for Today:

Jesus was in great agony as He prepared to faced death (Lk. 22:41-44).
Although Jesus cried out to God, asking to be delivered, He was 
prepared to suffer humiliation, separation from His Father, and death
in order to do God's will...

At times we will undergo trials, not because we want to suffer, but because
we want to obey God. Let Jesus' obedience sustain and encourage you
in times of trial...

You will be able to face anything if you know that Jesus Christ is with you.
Have you ever felt that God didn't hear your prayers? Be sure you are 
praying with reverent submission, willing to do what God wants. God 
responds to His obedient children...

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Heavenly Father, I can not even imagine what You felt
as You approached the time of Your separation from Your 
Father, but I do thank You for being obedient to the Father's
will. I pray for a greater sensitivity and obedience to His will.
I pray for obedience that I may become a better witness for
Him, in Jesus name Amen...

keep looking up, with an attitude of gratitude...
You're in the prayers of two who care...
Pastor Al & Marcie Sather
original_reflection_text: Jesus was in great agony as He prepared to faced death (Luke 22:41-44). Although Jesus cried out to God, asking to be delivered, He was prepared to suffer humiliation, separation from His Father, and death in order to do God's will. At times we will undergo trials, not because we want to suffer, but because we want to obey God. Let Jesus' obedience sustain and encourage you in times of trial. You will be able to face anything if you know that Jesus Christ is with you. Have you ever felt that God didn't hear your prayers? Be sure you are praying with reverent submission, willing to do what God wants. God responds to His obedient children.
original_verse_text: During the days of Jesus' life on earth, He offered up prayers and petitions with loud cries and tears to the One who could save Him from death, and He was heard because of His reverent submission.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I can not even imagine what You felt as You approached the time of Your separation from Your Father, but I do thank You for being obedient to the Father's will. I pray for a greater sensitivity and obedience to His will. I pray for obedience that I may become a better witness for Him, in Jesus name Amen.
reflection: Jesus was in great agony as He prepared to faced death (Luke 22:41-44). Although Jesus cried out to God, asking to be delivered, He was prepared to suffer humiliation, separation from His Father, and death in order to do God's will. At times we will undergo trials, not because we want to suffer, but because we want to obey God. Let Jesus' obedience sustain and encourage you in times of trial. You will be able to face anything if you know that Jesus Christ is with you. Have you ever felt that God didn't hear your prayers? Be sure you are praying with reverent submission, willing to do what God wants. God responds to His obedient children.
subject: Facing Trials with Obedient Faith
verse_text: During the days of Jesus' life on earth, He offered up prayers and petitions with loud cries and tears to the One who could save Him from death, and He was heard because of His reverent submission.
